summary: An ordinance submitting to the qualified voters of the City of Seattle at the general election to be held in such city on Tuesday, March 11, 1924, the proposition of creating an indebtedness in the sum of One Million Five Hundred Thousand ($1,500,000) Dollars, and the issuance and sale therefor of general negotiable interest bearing coupon bonds of said city in said amount, for the purpose of constructing a bridge across the west waterway at West Spokane Street; repealing Ordinance No. 46184, and declaring an emergency.
